intro: Rosa ripartii, commonly known as the alpine rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it has thorny stems typical of many rose species. Rosa ripartii is well adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
